required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Tube Position According to the Changes of Neck Position Between Two Different Types of Nasotracheal Tubes
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Tube Position According to the Changes of Neck Position Between Two Different Types of Nasotracheal Tubes

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the appropriateness of the two kinds of nasotracheal tube (PORTEX POLAR [Smiths Medical International, Hythe, United Kingdom], Mallinckrodt TaperGuard [Covidien, Ireland]) depth in neutral, extended and flexed neck position when the upper border of the cuff of endotracheal tube is located 3cm below the vocal cords in neutral neck position.

primary_outcome.measure: The adequacy of nasotracheal tube tip location in neutral, extended and flexed neck position
primary_outcome.description: whether the tube tip is located above the carina in neutral, extended and flexed neck position when the upper border of the cuff of endotracheal tube is fixed 3cm below the vocal cords (in neutral neck position). the distance from the carina to the tube tip in neutral, extended and flexed neck position when the upper border of the cuff of endotracheal tube is fixed 3cm below the vocal cords (in neutral neck position).

secondary_outcome.measure: The adequacy of nasotracheal tube cuff location in extended and flexed neck position
secondary_outcome.description: whether the tube cuff is located below the vocal cords in extended and flexed neck position when the upper border of the cuff of endotracheal tube is fixed 3cm below the vocal cords in neutral neck position.

secondary_outcome.measure: The adequacy of nasotracheal tube length
secondary_outcome.description: whether the tube cuff cannot be located 3cm below the vocal cords owing to short length of nasotracheal tube.

arm_group.description: usage of PORTEX POLAR [Smiths Medical International, Hythe, United Kingdom] nasotracheal tube
usage of Mallinckrodt TaperGuard [Covidien, Ireland] nasotracheal tube

intervention.description: nasotracheal intubation with PORTEX POLAR [Smiths Medical International, Hythe, United Kingdom] nasotracheal tube.
nasotracheal intubation with Mallinckrodt TaperGuard [Covidien, Ireland] nasotracheal tube.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Adult patients who undergoes elective surgery under general anesthesia with nasotracheal intubation
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients under 20 years old
2. Patients with ASA class IV or higher
3. Pregnant women
4. Patients receiving emergency surgery
5. Patients who have nasal disease or who undergo nose surgery because of nasal disease
6. Patient with craniofacial anomaly
7. Patients with impaired cervical motion
8. Patients who can not read the consent form or are not fluent in Korean (illiterate, foreigner)
9. Patients who refused the clinical trial Patients with dementia or cognitive impairment

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Yonsei University College of Medicine
